content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, we can achieve this using the built-in string methods `lowercase` to make it lower case, `strip` to remove leading or trailing whitespaces, and `replace` function to replace spaces and hyphens with underscore. Here is a sample code for the function:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(strip(replace(col, " ", "_")))
end
```
In this code, `lowercase` method converts all upper case characters in string to lower case. `strip` removes any leading or trailing whitespace. The `replace` function replaces all occurrences of a substring with another substring in the given string. Here it is replacing space character " " with underscore "_".

You can use this function like this:
```julia
column_name = "My Column"
cleaned_column = clean_column(column_name)
print(cleaned_column) # Outputs: my_column
```
